greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of Stirling numbers of second kind (A048993) read mod 2.
comment: Also parity of triangles A103631, A121314, A133607, A208345. - _Philippe Deléham_, Jun 04 2012
reference: Brand, Neal; Das, Sajal; Jacob, Tom. The number of nonzero entries in recursively defined tables modulo primes. Proceedings of the Twenty-first Southeastern Conference on Combinatorics, Graph Theory, and Computing (Boca Raton, FL, 1990). Congr. Numer. 78 (1990), 47--59. MR1140469 (92h:05004).
link: Bill Gosper, Colored illustrations of triangle of Stirling numbers of second kind read mod 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7
mathematica: Table[Mod[StirlingS2[n, k], 2], {n, 0, 13}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 03 2016 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=0, 22, for(k=0, n, print1(stirling(n, k, 2) % 2, ", ")); print()); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 03 2016
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 03 2012
